author: Aloysius Xavier Lopez
text:
: Following allegations that a few Corporation engineers are planning to use government vehicles for transportation of cash for distribution during elections, the Chennai District Election Office has initiated an inquiry.

Following a complaint received by the Election Commission in this regard, officials at the Chennai District Election Office have planned to strengthen surveillance among staff members too.

According to sources in Chennai District Election Office, officials are looking into various aspects of the allegation involving elected representatives. It is alleged that they have entrusted cash to a few engineers of the Chennai Corporation. The Chennai District Election Office has seized cash from only one location so far. Efforts are under way to strengthen the technology used by flying squads and static surveillance teams in all the 16 Assembly constituencies. “We sealed rooms of all elected representatives. Any effort by an elected representative of any party to misuse the official machinery will be thwarted,” said an official. As per the Model Code of Conduct, all parties and candidates should scrupulously avoid all activities that are “corrupt” and offences under the election law; these include bribing of voters, intimidation of voters, impersonation of voters and the transport and conveyance of voters to and from polling stations.

title: Chennai Corporation engineers under EC scanner
